    • Method Detail

      • getCustomVariables

        public java.util.ArrayList<CustomVariable> getCustomVariables()
        Returns the customVariables.
        Returns:
        customVariables

      • getCustomVariableFromName

        public java.lang.Object getCustomVariableFromName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value of the custom variable in customVariables with the name given.

        If name is null, or no variable with that name is found, return null.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the custom variable.
        Returns:
        The value of the customvariable with the name given. If no name given or one not found, return null.

      • setCustomVariableByName

        public void setCustomVariableByName(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value of the variable in customVariables with the name given.

        If no name given, then dont do anything.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the custom variable.
        value - The value that the custom variable will be set to.

      • attack

        public void attack(java.lang.String customString)
        Attacks the enemy with the currentWeapon.

        Calls the damaged method of the Enemy instance. If you want to just damage the player, then just use the damaged method directly.

        Parameters:
        customString - The string to be displayed with the default output.

        If alive is new false, then call the died() method.

      • setCurrentWeapon

        public void setCurrentWeapon(java.lang.String name)
        Sets inFight to the new weapoon with the name given. If the player is not carrying a weapon with that name (with the exception of fists), then don't do anything.
        Parameters:
        name - The new weapon's name.

      • calculateStrength

        public void calculateStrength()
        Calculates the strength of the player. Takes the player's weapon damage (If one is equipped). If a strength potion is in effect, multiply by defaultStrengthPotionMultiplier.

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        Gets the strength.
        Returns:
        strength

      • increaseHealthPotions

        public void increaseHealthPotions(int a)
        Increases the healthPotions by the value given.

        If the new value is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to increase by.

      • decreaseHealthPotions

        public void decreaseHealthPotions(int a)
        Decreases the healthPotions by the value given.

        If the new value is less than 0, then set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The value to decrease by.

      • useHealthPotion

        public void useHealthPotion()
        Heals the player and decreases the number of healthPotions by one if the player has one.

        Sets the healthPotions.

        If the new value is less than 0, then it is set to 0.

      • checkForLevelUp

        public boolean checkForLevelUp()
        Checks to see if the player can level up, and increases the level if so and sets experience to 0.

        The player levels up if the experience is greater than level*10+100.

        Returns:
        Whether or not the player has leveled up.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the score.
        Returns:
        score

      • increaseScore

        public void increaseScore(int a)
        Increases the score.

        If the new value is less than 0, set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The amount to increase by.

      • decreaseScore

        public void decreaseScore(int a)
        Decreases the score.

        If the new value is less than 0, set it to 0.

        Parameters:
        a - The amount to decrease by.

      • getHp

        public int getHp()
        Returns the hp.
        Returns:
        hp

      • damaged

        public void damaged(int a,
           java.lang.String customString)
        Decreases the hp if the player can be hurt this turn.

        If the new value is less than 0, set it to 0. If greater than maxhp, then set it to the maxhp.

        Parameters:
        a - The amount to of damage dealt.
        customString - The custom string to be outted next to the default output.

      • heal

        public void heal(int a)
        Increases the value of hp by the value given.

        If the new value given is less than 0, Then set it to 0. If greater than maxhp, then set it to the maxhp.

        Parameters:
        a - The amount healed.

      • getMaxHp

        public int getMaxHp()
        Returns the maxhp.
        Returns:
        maxhp

      • setMaxHp

        public void setMaxHp(int a)
        Sets the value of maxhp to the value given.

        If the value given is less than 1, Then set it to 1. If the new maxhp is less than health, then set the health to the new maxhp.

        Parameters:
        a - The new value.

      • getInventory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getInventory()
        Returns the inventory.
        Returns:
        inventory

      • addToInventory

        public void addToInventory(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String type)
        Adds an item to the player's inventory from TextFighter's item ArrayList.

        If either the name or type is null, do nothing.

        Loops through the TextFighter arrayList of the given type (eg. weapon, tool) and adds a clone of the item found with that name to the inventory. If that item does not exist, it tells the player.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        type - The type of the item.

      • removeFromInventory

        public void removeFromInventory(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String type)

      • isCarrying

        public boolean isCarrying(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String type)
        Returns whether or not the player is carrying an item with the name and type given.

        If the name or type is null, return false.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        type - The type of the item.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the player is carrying an item with the name and type given.

      • getFromInventory

        public Item getFromInventory(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String type)
        Returns an item with the given name and type. If there is none or name or type is null, then return null.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item.
        type - The type of the item.
        Returns:
        hether or not the player is carrying an item with the name and type given. If there is none or name or type is null, then return null.
